content.body: I like TypeScript, but I don't think that type comment proposal is a good idea...
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I like TypeScript, but I don't think that type comment proposal is a good idea...

content.body: the goal of that proposal, "make devs no need to transpile code" cannot be really achieved by this approach
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: the goal of that proposal, "make devs no need to transpile code" cannot be really achieved by this approach

content.formatted_body:
for example, TS 4.7 has a new syntax, instantiation expression like this:

const numberSet = Set<number>;
const set = new numberSet(); // type: Set<number>

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
for example, TS 4.7 has a new syntax, instantiation expression like this:

const numberSet = Set<number>;
const set = new numberSet(); // type: Set<number>

content.body: this syntax will somehow has ASI hazard if I don't write `;`
content.formatted_body: this syntax will somehow has ASI hazard if I don't write ;

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: this syntax will somehow has ASI hazard if I don't write `;`
this syntax will somehow has ASI hazard if I don't write ;

content.body: To achieve the goal of this proposal "make devs no need to transpile code", everytime Flow, TS, ... adds a new Type level syntax, we need to cover that in the language
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: To achieve the goal of this proposal "make devs no need to transpile code", everytime Flow, TS, ... adds a new Type level syntax, we need to cover that in the language

content.body: I don't think it's a good way to go.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I don't think it's a good way to go.

content.body: it can’t cover enums for example
I think the idea is just to take the `:` reserved token and make it comment-like instead
content.formatted_body: I think the idea is just to take the : reserved token and make it comment-like instead

content.body: so how does that make devs no need to transpile code? If we only have `:` style types
content.formatted_body: so how does that make devs no need to transpile code? If we only have : style types

content.body: I write a lot generics, conditional types, union/conjunction types, etc

content.body: it definitely lists lots of things beyond `:`, but also yes it is not everything in TS
content.formatted_body: it definitely lists lots of things beyond :, but also yes it is not everything in TS

content.body: given that this is just for development anyway, I wonder how hard it would be to make a chrome extension which rewrote typescript to js so developers could use that
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: given that this is just for development anyway, I wonder how hard it would be to make a chrome extension which rewrote typescript to js so developers could use that

content.body: it's very hard. From Jan 2022, you cannot upload new Manifest V2 extension, and you need webRequest API to modify network requests.
